author: Pauline
text: Edwina turned from the view of sailing ships, only to be confronted with the ubiquitous bustles of her fellows. "Oh, if only I could go off to sea," she thought. "Then I'd never have to wear a fake ass again!" #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/acwtwKjR1h

author: Pauline
text: By a "gentleman of fortune" they plainly meant neither more nor less than a common pirate ~ Robert Lewis Stevenson from Treasure Island (The Smugglers by Ivan Aivazovsky) #quote #TreasureIsland #ships #pirates https://t.co/P9OizA9rCi

author: Pauline
text: The reality that the maid could read and they couldn't was not lost on Abraham and Jeb. So they took to watching her when she did the magic, hoping they'd pick it up through the ether. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/3rdBtTKVq0

author: Pauline
text: A #Caturday  ostracon (cast aside shard of pottery or masonry) from Ancient Egypt. This homage to the pet cat breaks a few of the hard and fast rules under which temple and tomb artists usually worked. https://t.co/erSTlVSfc7

author: Pauline
text: Just dropping this here... #Easter2022 https://t.co/P03kPrAHw3

author: Pauline
text: "Drama Queen," the doll thought as she burned a hole in the back of the monster's head with her stare. "You'll have to sleep some time, Celeste. And when you do, I'll see to it that both Mr. Bun Bun and I have our freedom once again." #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/YI0cCyv3St

author: Pauline
text: I am an optimist about things in general, but I look upon the sea as the ancients viewed their gods, with superstition. ~ E.A. Pye (Sea View by Moonlight by Ivan Aivazovsky) #sea #SuperstitionSat #art #quote https://t.co/VOtytNK1he

author: Pauline
text: Even a man who's pure of heart and says his prayers by night; Can become a wolf when the wolf's-bane blooms and the moon is full and bright. (Pen and ink by Marie Zolotuhkina) #WerewolfWednesday #FolkloreThursday https://t.co/2IaNPyoPoa

author: Pauline
text: Did we bring six or seven tiny, wicker coffins for the sacrificial birds? Oh well. Regardless, I brought the cherries! #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/sY5krf28gw

author: Pauline
text: Medieval marginalia lets us know why nuns, who were not permitted to have pets, could keep cats. #Caturday https://t.co/0k5dc4Bxxo

author: Pauline
text: Sailors get to know each other better when there is a storm. ~ French Proverb (painting by Andres Zorn) #sailing #boat #art #quote https://t.co/QtYIS6MqA8

author: Pauline
text: I married him for his flowing locks, you see. Now the only thing locked is his mouth. Hasn't spoken to me in months. And, to be fair, his mouth isn't the only thing that's locked. But look at me, going on. What was your name? #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/sMHEdHpt4V

author: Pauline
text: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm. ~ Willa Cather (Stormy Sea at Night by Ivan Aivazovsky) #sailing #art #quote https://t.co/NFaBTm1yU2

author: Pauline
text: The masterful Arthur Rackham makes #FolkloreThursday more beautiful with an illustration from Irish Folktales published in 1920. One wonders - frogs: friends or foes? https://t.co/l3g5AWlL5e

author: Pauline
text: The Hackener family had left Bristol for the Caribbean eighteen weeks prior. But thanks to the exactingly crafted automatons they left behind, no one in the neighborhood missed them at all. Not even when older son Dustin came to visit Mum. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/DDsXvOSeKi

author: Pauline
text: A Qing Dynasty Chinese hanging scroll makes #Caturday fluffy. https://t.co/1H0Fd2nOwK

author: Pauline
text: The goal is not to sail the boat, but rather to help the boat sail herself. ~ John Rousmaniere (Fog 1807 by Caspar Freidrich) #sail #art #quote https://t.co/K73OZWNqe6

author: Pauline
text: The saint #OTD is Dismas, the Good Thief. He was crucified with Christ. He asked for forgiveness and was granted same as he hung on the cross. He is the patron of thieves, perhaps repentant or not. (Crucifixion by Jan van Eyck via Wikipedia) https://t.co/jXYJDvOeET

author: Pauline
text: Saint Jeanne d'Arc Entering Orleans by Jean-Jacques Scherer https://t.co/ZVAkwkArBX

author: Pauline
text: Once again, the Witch of the Dell seduced the gravediggers away from their work, keeping them busy until nightfall. No one would ever know what she did with all those bodies. Or why their village had the happiest gravediggers in the county. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/3Li2i2064d

author: Pauline
text: A noble lady and a cat in a Persian oil painting from the late 18th or early 19th century. Nothing says #Caturday more beautifully. (Edits by blondebrainpower on Tumblr) https://t.co/aMeBZlpFHU

author: Pauline
text: The full moon looms. And #FolkloreThursday seems a fitting time to allow Camille Renversades to remind us that turning into a werewolf is not for the weak. #WerewolfWednesday https://t.co/7ug3PlLfl9

author: Pauline
text: All right, Desi. One more reading of brother Hector's letter from the Quasi-War and, so help me, I'll take that kitten of yours and move to France! #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/UmaCSRSg6p

author: Pauline
text: Everyone knows cats and sailors go together (no one likes rodents in their hammock, after all). So here's a #Caturday cat, helping get things ship shape. https://t.co/6AYaq5bndX

author: Pauline
text: Dad, come along now. You needn't look so stern. In fact, you should be happy for me, playing Peter Pan on Broadway. It is the opportunity of a lifetime! So cheer up for f*ck's sake. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/EMgnKseebm

author: Pauline
text: A #Caturday point well made. (From Cattitude Daily on FB) https://t.co/SSYPeZf9ai

author: Pauline
text: Jazz Club, New Orleans by Orville Bullman, 1954. https://t.co/PbH0Id84R2

author: Pauline
text: Oh honestly, Melinda. I can't with this pretense anymore. All you have to do is look at those children and you know they're not my husband's. Meanwhile, he's having an affair with this pert governess. You finish the walk, will you? I'm going home to have a scotch. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/FgahDTGPoX

author: Pauline
text: Steinlen cats. Cause #Caturday https://t.co/ka93QuxLky

author: Pauline
text: I'm on the sea! I'm on the sea! I am where I would ever be. ~ Bryan Waller Procter #ship #sea #quote https://t.co/XnSipX6rlG

author: Pauline
text: Also, I do know the difference between "you're" and "your". Ugh.

author: Pauline
text:
Well, Linda, I guess mother was right after all.
And how is that, dear?
If your riding that thing, it really is time to get married. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/iksfvVMDtO

author: Pauline
text: Let's tune up our instruments and raise our voices in song for a #Caturday Serenade (unknown artist, possibly Dutch, mid-17th century). https://t.co/TZ625J5E16

author: Pauline
text: On this third and final day of the full moon remember, there's more than one way to deflect a werewolf... Just in case. #FolkloreThursday https://t.co/dTG4IGd6bO

author: Pauline
text: #OTD our saint is Verdiana. An anchorite, Verdiana had herself walled up in a small cell adjacent to a church. She was said to be visited often by two snakes who were her helpers in prayer. An odd choice of pets, for a saint. (Fresco from the Museo St Verdiana) https://t.co/WmPWcX5JR3

author: Pauline
text: The train to Sleepville eluded Mahitabelle. But that didn't stop her from watching others enjoy the ride. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/luWBcEKIeO

author: Pauline
text: #Caturday love from Norway circa 1967 https://t.co/SNVrgdooMo

author: Pauline
text: Currents will have their way ~ Herman Melville (A Ship in a Stormy Sea by Ivan Aivazovsky)  #ships #HermanMelville #quote #art https://t.co/aowWS05fjS

author: Pauline
text: And for the saint #OTD we have Apollonia, patron of dentists and tooth problems. This aging deaconess had her teeth out by a mob. She eventually jumped into a roaring fire to avoid being forced to speak against her church. (Drawing by Jacobo Zucchi) https://t.co/Todr07ElS2

author: Pauline
text: The saint #OTD is Amand. Born to a wealth family in Poitou in 584 he gave all that up to become a missionary in what is now Belgium. There he is embraced by brewers, wine makers and bartenders as their patron. (Statue in the Église Saint-Maurice via Wikipedia) https://t.co/KboG098ru9

author: Pauline
text:
It's not you, Stephen.
No?
Not at all.
Then what?
If you must know, it's the knot of wood on this fence that's assaulting my bustle. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/PI2q7zDosH

author: Pauline
text: And a very literary #Caturday to young and old alike. https://t.co/GmIgvQdh13

author: Pauline
text: It's #FolkloreThursday and, once again, I am thankful the Set has bested the beast Apophis so that we can see another dawn. (From Mythic Cosmics and Art on Trumblr) https://t.co/Iemh84sEYr

author: Pauline
text: The Saint #OTD is Melangell, a Welsh prioress who is patron saint of rabbits and wild places. Some say she is a hidden Celtic goddess of early spring, much like Brigit in Ireland. (St. Melangell's shrine in Wales via Wikipedia) https://t.co/QL7oQX1WEK

author: Pauline
text: I'll give you $15 for it, lady. Most you'll get anywhere for one that young. #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/3ZxZzXEM0o

author: Pauline
text: It's #Caturday and the Gray Eminence is more interested in kittens than in statecraft. (Richelieu and His Cats by Charles Edouard Delort) https://t.co/TdYGF6se5j

author: Pauline
text: The Saint #OTD is Sava of Serbia. Born a noble around 1230, he chose a monastic life and brought orthodoxy to Serbia. Legends tell of his close friendship with wolves. Much of his story flows over into #FolkloreThursday as well (icon via Wikipedia) https://t.co/ofumnhMdBi

author: Pauline
text: The Saint #OTD is Emerentiana. A young Roman noblewoman who was the foster-sister of St. Agnes. After the latter's death, Emerentiana went to her grave to pray and was stoned to death by a pagan mob. (Portrait from the Peruvian School) https://t.co/xZTAkKC5RT

author: Pauline
text:
"Dulce! Da says you have to take Mrs. O'Tully's harp back to her. Now!"
"Tell Da to suck eggs, Liz. I'm right in the middle of 'Enter Sandman' and you know it." #GirlsOwnCC https://t.co/x5GpTSGwvF

author: Pauline
text: Keeping to the Norse theme this #Caturday with a lithograph of the beautiful goddess Freya and her beloved kitties. https://t.co/gaBsCdZW9a
